title: "They know so little of the world they traverse."
body:
It's an uneventful rainy day today and unfortunately for everyone else I have enough free time to comprise this load of random trivia. I figured some people might appreciate this, if not perhaps it will be useful for map making hobbyists. Otherwise let me know if something is amiss, as this entire thing is a rough mock up and I was bound to make a few small mistakes.

FYI constructing this through the boards was a painful process, I would recommend viewing from a computer screen rather than cellphone as the format change might've screwed with everything. :-P
https://vignette.wikia.nocookie.net/leagueoflegends/images/7/7b/Runeterra_Crest.png/revision/latest?cb=20161117185203
# Valoran:

>##[Demacia]
The kingdom of Demacia is an insular country located in the west of Valoran, sharing its borders with Noxus & the Freljord. The currently known locations encompassing Demacia are:  

>- Castle Wrenwall      - High Silvermere 
- Pinara                       - Needlebrook 
- Edessa                     - Jandelle
- Fossbarrow             - Uwendale
- Lissus                      - Terbisia
- Dawnhold                - Evenmoor
- Velorus

>- Greenfang Mountains      - Fields of Brashmore
- Gates of Mourning           - Whiterock
- Memorial Road                 - Alabaster Library
- Serpentrion River             - Cloudwoods


> ## [Noxus]
The empire of Noxus is a nation centralized on the eastern coast of Valoran, encroaching it's borders with many other regions. All currently known locations within Noxus are:

>- Basilich        - Drakengate 
- Ironwater     - Grannit
- Fallgren        - Vindor
- Rokrund       - Kilgrove
- Urzeris (Shurima)
- Bel'Zhun (Shurima)
- Grannit (Shurima)
- Andras (Demacia)
- Delverhold

>- Ironspike Mountains      - Drugne
- Rugg         - Trevail           - Drekan
- Northern Steppes      - Dalamor Plain
- Rokrund Plain


>## [Freljord]
The unforgiving tundra of the Freljord sits atop the known world in the northern reaches of Valoran, sharing it's borders with Demacia and Noxus. Currently known locations are:
- Frostguard Citadel          - Iceborn Fortress (ruins)
- Raklestake            - Glaserport
- Howling Abyss           - Lokfar 
- Frostheld        - Hearth-home (ruins)


>## [Miscellaneous]
- Silent Forrest        - Vaskasian Villages
- Palclyff                   - Glorft (George Kristic?)
- Stonewall              - Qualthala
- Krexor                    - Holdrum

 
#Unidentified southern continent:
>## [Shurima]
The vast Shurima wastes makes up the majority of the southern continent. All currently known location are: 

>- Vekaura (ruins)         - Kenethet
- Nashramae               - Kalamanda
- Zuretta                      - Bai-Zhek
- Saabara                    - Amakra
- Zirima                       - Tejaru
- Nerimazeth (Xerath's self-proclaimed capital)
-  Icathia

>- Fortress Siram (Ruins)     - Lake Imalli
- Sai Khaleek       - Tomb of the Emperors
- Oasis of the Dawn       - Mother of Life (river)
- Crystal Scar

 
# Ionia:
>##[Zhyun]
The south-most province in Ionia
>- Jyom Pass           - Kashuri Armories
- Navori                  - Shon-Xan
- Tuula prison        - Kinkou Monastry
- Pallas        - Raikkon

>##[Undisclosed locations]
- Vlonqo                    - Tevasa Moutain
- Lhradi Forest          - Ghetu (desert)
- Nistaram Forest 
- Shojin                     - Hirana Academy
- Epool River             - Omikayalan Grove
- Puboe prison         - Bard Mountain

If you're wondering why other important locations have not been mentioned here, it's deliberate. Basically there was either next to no information about any towns or landmarks within the region (Eg, Targon and Shadow Isles) or it hasn't been re-established after the retcon. 

Edit: Also feel free to ask for more details about any specific names and places, either I or someone else could possibly explain.

Okey for both Piltover and Zaun these are for now all the locations I could find, as well as where its located. (Im using these questionable forum listings to get the point of where is where) For more, you can go to the [wiki Runeterra page](http://leagueoflegends.wikia.com/wiki/Runeterra).

As you can see some locations overlap, such as the symbiotic nature of both cities.

Pallas is actually way south, since it can be seen on the Piltover Medarda map.

> [{quoted}](name=Tesla Effect,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=BeZE9fW5,comment-id=00100000,timestamp=2018-03-13T17:08:17.565+0000)
>
> Pallas is actually way south, since it can be seen on the Piltover Medarda map.

Both right, especially if you check the Varus: Heartlight comic, pages [7](https://universe.leagueoflegends.com/en_US/comic/varus/issue-1/5/) and [18](https://universe.leagueoflegends.com/en_US/comic/varus/issue-1/10/).

Anything you can share about the "Gates of Mourning"? I don't recognise a lot of these places, but that one in particular stands out as interesting.

You said that you're not including regions without known landmarks, but I think there's enough information on [this page](https://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/news/game-updates/special-event/first-light-after-harrowing) about Bilgewater. Pretty sure it's canon.

> Anything you can share about the "Gates of Mourning"?

_"Dark of hair and keen of eye was Diadoro, the bearded swordsman who’d held the Gates of Mourning against the armored host of the Trifarian Legion for an entire day."_

Other than that the _Gates of Mourning_ literally means nothing. Which goes for a lot of the lore's details. There's intriguing stuff out there it's just so minor, blink and you'll miss it. 

>  I think there's enough information on this page about Bilgewater.

Oh true cuz! Geez, it's been 3 years since Bligewater's update. I can't even recall what the Isles are called anymore, was it Serpent or Blue Flame Isles?  Regardless, so glad to be revisiting there soon.

> [{quoted}](name=Whyte Lyon,realm=OCE,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=BeZE9fW5,comment-id=00030000,timestamp=2018-03-12T08:30:02.276+0000)
>
> Geez, it's been 3 years since Bligewater's update. I can't even remember what the Isles are called anymore, was it Serpent or Blue Flame?  Regardless, glad to be revisiting there sometime soon.

Bilgewater is located on the Blue Flame Islands.

Funny thing is, of all the lore about Bilgwater and the isles it's located at, it mentions Blue Flame like 2-3 times tops. However Illaoi's lore mentions Serpent Isles once. Could be a mistake that's gone forgotten after all this time, or it could mean both exist. I dun know, mostly joking there but who knows...

> [{quoted}](name=Whyte Lyon,realm=OCE,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=BeZE9fW5,comment-id=0003000000000000,timestamp=2018-03-12T09:28:32.921+0000)
>
> Funny thing is, of all the lore about Bilgwater and the isles it's located at, it mentions Blue Flame like 2-3 times tops. However Illaoi's lore mentions Serpent Isles once. Could be a mistake that's gone forgotten after all this time, or it could mean both exist. I dun know, mostly joking there but who knows...

Serpent Isles or Blue Flame Islands is one and the same, they just have different names depending on what culture you ask.

Ah, that's one of the dudes from "For Demacia", isn't it?
Shame we don't know what they're mourning about.

The ~~fryone flats ~~were mentioned recently

EDIT: Tempest Flats
And where would you have seen that, through lore or from a dev?

> [{quoted}](name=Whyte Lyon,realm=OCE,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=BeZE9fW5,comment-id=000c0000,timestamp=2018-03-13T08:10:07.155+0000)
>
> And where would you have seen that, through lore or from a dev?

im sorry it was Tempest Flats, not the Fryone Flats

Noxus lore update for Vlad:
https://universe.leagueoflegends.com/en_US/story/champion/vladimir/
http://leaguefactions.wikia.com/wiki/Tempest_Flats

None of Vlad's live lore was mentioned "recently" it's all old school stuff that's still waiting to be updated. 

If you go to Vlads profile page over at the wiki. You should notice that same Bio you linked has been replaced with an entirely new one. Now if you go to the "Vladimir/history" section you'll find "previous lore" where that outdated bio now lives.

Thanks! 

{{sticker:sg-jinx}}
Somehow, I feel like League took inspiration from the other pink-haired girl from Future Diary.
Is this icon leak for the new ingame cursor? because the current one looks completely out of place

Note:

- Mount Targon, based on some of the maps in Shurima, is somewhere in the southern continent, likely south-west of most of our familiar Shurima.
- Bilgewater is to the east of the Southern Shurima continent, and the Shadow Isles are even further to the east than that (and likely a bit more south).
- PIltover/Zaun is located on a thin connection (possibly artificial) between Valoran and the southern Shurima continent

https://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/featured/piltover/medarda-heirloom

https://vignette.wikia.nocookie.net/leagueoflegends/images/2/2e/Shurima_map.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20150227214027

> - PIltover/Zaun is located on a thin connection (possibly artificial) between Valoran and the southern Shurima continent

Piltover and Zaun are part of both Valoran and Southern Continent, like Istanbul / Constantinople is part of Europe and Asia.
Yeah
Great formatting

Those noxus locations will be helpful for my Noxus Field guide

https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/story-art/10p7klMX-noxus-field-guide-prep
{{champion:24}} ICATHIA IS NOT PART OF SHURIMA!!!

> [{quoted}](name=Fedora Noodle,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=BeZE9fW5,comment-id=000b,timestamp=2018-03-12T15:59:43.927+0000)
>
> {{champion:24}} ICATHIA IS NOT PART OF SHURIMA!!!

Its located in the Shuriman wastes, there for its within Shurima. This doesnt mean its politically part of it, or it actually mattering now since Icathia got wrecked by Void monsters for ages.

Okay so im not ignorant of this. But this list is comprised of cities and landmarks from each region, Icathia is a city but it isnt a region (or at least lore doesnt detail it so). Which means if I was to include it separately, it would be an extremely short sub-section. 

> ##[Icathia]
Icathia is a lost city boardering Shurima in the southeast part of the Southern Continent. All currently known locations are:
>- Saabara


Hell im not even confident Saabara should be included, it's not actually specified as territory under Icathian jurisdiction.
What about the plague jungles
What about the Kumungu Jungle?

Canon Targon locations are:
Mount Targon (on it we have Rakkor cave settlements (which has Threshold gateways, Temple of the Solstice, Solari prayer shrines), Divine  carvings, and The Peak (which goes to Targon Prime))

Thank you, this will help a lot for wiki categorization, though in my experience I have found and categorized additional locations and places there.

PS: Glorft and Krexor are part of Noxus
disregard earlier posts; misinterpreted headings
